catalogue_raissonne: Murase, Art through a Lifetime, no. 230
creditline: Mary Griggs Burke Collection, Gift of the Mary and Jackson Burke Foundation
description: five women lounging with instruments, books, fans; bald man at L with back to viewer playing stringed instrument; decorative screen ULQ; women in bright kimonos
text: Five fashionable prostitute and a male figure playing the shamisen gather before a folding screen painted with an autumnal scene of a red sun and white chrysanthemums. One of the elegant prostitutes also plays a shamisen, while two others read books. Red and white Chinese characters on the garment of the prostitute at right read “flower” and “cherry blossoms,” age-old symbols of the ephemerality of beauty and youth. Two small red seals on the far right of the folding screen within the painting identify the artist as the early ukiyo-e master Hishikawa Moronobu.
title: Musical Party
